name: Learn Unity
tagline: Unity project examples for the book Learn Unity 4 for iOS Game Development
body: This is the GitHub page for the book Learn Unity 4 for iOS Game Development and the accompanying Learn Unity bowling game app. # The Code The GitHub projects, built up cumulatively through each chapter to create a bowling game similar in style to [HyperBowl](http://hyperbowl3d.com/), do not include assets from the Unity Asset Store and Standard Assets that are used in the book, but you can use them a starting point or to save time in constructing the book examples (but taking shortcuts isn't really recommended). The projects are covered under the MIT open source license. # The Book Learn Unity 4 for iOS Game Development is now available! * [Apress alpha ebook](http://www.apress.com/9781430248750) * [Amazon](http://www.amazon.com/Learn-Unity-iOS-Game-Development/dp/1430248750) (print and kindle book) * [Barnes and Noble](http://www.barnesandnoble.com/w/learn-unity-4-for-ios-game-development-philip-chu/1113931582?ean=9781430248750) (print and nook book) * [Goodreads](http://www.goodreads.com/book/show/17063557-learn-unity-4-for-ios-game-development) (links to online bookstores * [Google Books](http://books.google.com/books/about/Learn_Unity_4_for_iOS_Game_Development.html) The book introduces Unity starting with installation and activation, learning the interface with the included Angry Bots demo, and then builds up successively more elaborate project examples from scratch and using free assets from the Unity Asset Store. A simple spinning cube and dancing skeleton scene is constructed, but most of the book is devoted to building a 3D bowling game with the control style of [HyperBowl](http://hyperbowl3d.com/). The game is first developed and tested in the Unity Editor, incorporating graphics, scripting (with JavaScript), physics, sound, user interface, complete rules for a bowling game, and mouse controls. The game is then adapted to run on iOS with touchscreen and (a little bit of) accelerometer input. Testing with the Unity Remote, iOS Simulator and real devices is explained, Game Center and iAd integration is covered, and then optimization techniques are described. The book concludes with a brief treatment of miscellaneous topics such as C# scripting, Unity Editor scripting, Android development, and tracking and promoting sales. Technical review was provided by Marc Sh√•rer of [Gayasoft](http://gayasoft.ch). ## Chapter Contents ### Getting Started Download and install Unity, license activation, bug reporting, getting help. ### A Unity Tour Use the Angry Bots demo to learn the Unity user interface: built-in and custom layouts, the Scene, Game, Hierarchy, Inspector and Project Views, how to open a project, open a scene and play a scene. ### Making a Scene Create a new scene with primitive objects, lighting, skybox, camera control, importing Standard Assets, and making prefabs. ### Making it Move: Scripting the Cube Create scripts, understanding callbacks, editing with MonoDevelop, debugging with MonoDevelop. ### Let's Dance! Animation and Sound Create a dancing skeleton scene by importing a free skeleton package from the Asset Store, selecting and looping a dance animation, importing and looping music, adding a floor, activating dynamic shadows. ### Let's Roll! Physics and Controls Start a new bowling game scene: add a bowling ball, add physics materials and rigidbodies, script a physics-based bowing ball controls. ### Let's Bowl! Advanced Physics Add bowling pins, a bowling ball game controller, pin collision sounds, ball rolling sound, collision callbacks. ### Let's Play! Scripting the Game Implement complete bowling game rules as a finite state machine, using coroutines. ### The Game GUI Implement a scoreboard and pause menu using UnityGUI. ### Using Unity iOS Build Angry Bots as an iOS app, testing it in the Editor with Unity Remote and on the iOS Simulator in Xcode. ### Building for Real: Device Testing and App Submission Set up provisioning profiles and test devices on the Provisioning Portal, setting up an app on iTunes Connect, build and run Angry Bots for testing and distribution. ### Presentation: Screens and Icons Back to bowling: adding icons and splash screens, specifying screen orientation, dislaying activity indicators, scaling UnityGUI for different screen resolutions. ### Handling Device Input Add touchscreen controls, detecting shakes with the accelerometer, displaying a video texture with the iOS camera as a webcam. ### Game Center: Leaderboards and Achievements Set up Game Center leaderboards and achievements in iTunes Connect and use the Unity Social class to access them. ### iAd: Banner Ads and Interstitial Ads Add banner and interstitial (full-screen) ads with iAd. ### Optimization Run the built-in and Editor-based profiler, optimizing code and assets for speed, size and/or quality. ### Where to Go from Here? Misc topics: Android, C#, Editor scripting, script execution order, publishing on the Asset Store. # Asset Store The book utilizes free packages from the Unity Asset Store: * [Eighteen Free Substances](https://www.assetstore.unity3d.com/#/content/1352) from [Allegorithmic](http://allegorithmic.com) * [Free ArtskillZ Texture Pack 01](https://www.assetstore.unity3d.com/#/content/351) from [ArtskillZ](http://artskillz.net) * [Skeletons Pack](https://www.assetstore.unity3d.com/#/content/1818) from [bisaniyehocam](https://www.assetstore.unity3d.com/#/publisher/645) * [General Music Set](https://www.assetstore.unity3d.com/#/content/2589) from [Gianmarco Leone](http://gianmarcoleone.com/) * [Free SFX Package](https://www.assetstore.unity3d.com/#/content/5178) from [Bleep Blop Audio](http://bleepblopaudio.com/) * [Barrel](https://www.assetstore.unity3d.com/#/content/840) from [Universal Image](http://monstertruckherohd.com/) * [iTween](http://itween.pixelplacement.com) from [Pixel Placement](http://pixelplacement.com) * [Necromancer GUI](https://www.assetstore.unity3d.com/#/content/366) from [Ironbound Studios](http://ironboundstudios.com/) Several other packages are mentioned but not directly incorporated: * [Prime31 plugins](http://prime31.com/) * [Transitions Manager](http://dftgames.com/) * [EZGUI](http://anbsoft.com) * [NGUI](http://tasharen.com/) * [GUIKit001](http://gameassets.net) * [Finger Gestures](http://fatalfrog.com/) * [Jukebox Free](http://corruptedsmilestudio.blogspot.com/) And also the following app stats tracking programs: * [Appviz](http://appviz.com/) * [AppAnnie](http://appannie.com/) * [AppFigures](http://appfigures.com/) # Support Questions can be posted on the [Unity forum](http://forum.unity3d.com/threads/173210-Learn-Unity-for-iOS-Game-Development), any of my Facebook pages ([Technicat](http://facebook.com/technicatllc), [Fugu Games](http://facebook.com/fugugames) or [HyperBowl](http://facebook.com/hyperbowl)) and on [twitter](http://twitter.com/fugugames). # Corrections and Clarifications ## Retail Description * Some retail descriptions list Unity's Mecanim animation system. The book does mention but does not use Mecanim. Instead, a chapter is devoted to a dancing skeleton example using Unity's Legacy animation system and a free skeleton package on the Asset Store. * Some retail descriptions list Unity's support for gyroscope on iOS devices. The book does mention but does not use Unity's gyroscope API (Input.gyroscope). The book does describe how to access the touchscreen (Input.touches), accelerometer (Input.accelerometer), and webcam (WebCamTexture). ## Ebooks ### Apress alpha * Hasn't been updated to the final copy. ### Nook * URL's display with markup and are not active as links. * All the quoted titles in the Explore Further sections should be links to the Unity online documentation (for the Scripting Reference pages, try searching for those terms in the Scripting Reference search box). ### Kindle * Figure links don't always work. * Same issue as the nook re missing links in the Explore Further sections. ## Text Page numbers correspond to the print version. Links are provided to the online Unity documentation cited in the Explore Further sections. ### About the Author * page xxi: Snow Crash should be italicized. Google Play and the Amazon Appstore (see below). ### Back Cover * "Three-dimensional games" should read "3D games" (does anyone say "three-dimensional games" or "three-dimensional movies?") # The App The [HyperBowl](http://hyperbowl3d.com/)-style bowling game developed by following the book, complete with Asset Store assets and Unity Standard Assets, is [on the App Store](https://itunes.apple.com/app/learn-unity/id634845779 Learn Unity app). There is also an Android version [on Google Play](https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=com.technicat.HyperBowlComplete) and the [Amazon appstore](http://www.amazon.com/Technicat-LLC-Learn-Unity/dp/B00DHYHKJU/ref=sr_1_14?s=mobile-apps&ie=UTF8&qid=1371837470&sr=1-14). # Other Books You may also be interested in Sue Blackman's [Beginning 3D Game Development with Unity](http://forum.unity3d.com/threads/93775-Beginning-3D-Game-Development-with-Unity/page17) (also from Apress), Will Goldstone's [Unity 3.x Game Development Essentials] (http://www.packtpub.com/unity-3-x-game-development-essentials-with-c-and-javascript-will-goldstone/book), and Jeff Murray's [Game Development for iOS with Unity3D] (http://www.crcpress.com/product/isbn/9781439892190).
